revised_title: Observations of the Solar Eclipse of September 13, 1699
tldr: Dr. David Gregory shares his observations of the solar eclipse that occurred on September 13, 1699. He provides a detailed scheme of the phases of the eclipse and notes that the event ended precisely 24 minutes and 9 seconds after 10 am. Gregory also mentions the maximum observation of the eclipse, which was 10 digits and a quarter, occurring 7 minutes after 9 am.
